root: ^Nessie seems more chipper than the previous evening, maybe she has had better luck with the guests?
^“Do you want the good news or the bad news first??”
^Good news first, always the better option.
^“A positive one. That’s what I like to see!”
^“Well… go on and close your eyes. I won’t be a minute!”
^You oblige, covering your face. You wonder what crazy plan she’s come up with this time…
^You uncover your eyes to reveal Nessie in a wetsuit. How did she find equipment this quickly??
^Her face remains cheerful, but her voice doesn’t match. She quickly puts her lab coat back on, covering up the diving gear.
^“I got a very angry text this morning from my supervisors…”
^“It seems like my laptop sent out some sort of distress ping from its accidental resting place at the bottom of your lake.”
^“Needless to say, they were NOT impressed with me.”
^“If my research isn’t recovered, my internship may be at risk!!”
^“I worked so hard for this, so it seems such a waste to lose it all for a silly mistake.”

careful: ^“You think I don’t know that already??!”
^“I really don’t need two people telling me off today.”
^“I thought you were here to help me…”
^She looks off into the distance sadly. You don’t know how to explain that you were only trying to encourage her to be mindful for the future.
notyou: ^“They should be more understanding. Accidents happen!”
^“I know, right?? Especially since our facility is near water, for water based creatures.”
^“I would have thought this is a common issue with an easy solution.”
^“I suppose they are just being harsh to encourage me… Still, I really want this job!”
^You try your best to reassure her. You will find a way to get this all sorted. Her research isn’t lost just yet!
stepback: ^“Let’s take a step back for a minute and think.”
^“Alright, yeah. You’re right. There’s no use stressing out right away.”
^“That um, wasn’t all my bad news though…”
^You notice she makes a concerted effort to maintain composure.
^“You’ve seen my new wetsuit, but I am still missing some stuff.”
^“I still need a diving tank to be able to reach the right water level…”
^“So uhh, I’m going to have to ask you again…”
^You had a gut feeling this was coming from a mile away…
^“It’ll only be for 5 minutes, you could even do it for me!”
^“I just have to order the remaining equipment, I even got a good website recommendation from Critter!!”
^Even thinking about the havoc she could cause to the Foggy Lake Systems fills you with great unease…
computerok: ^You really feel her plight. Besides… your Boss can’t really be watching every single move you make, right?
^“I will do this for you, just this once.”
^“But… You are not touching the computer. I will do everything for you.”
^“I’m really really happy you changed your mind, receptionist!!”
^“I have to go and prepare right away!! Everything is gonna turn out ok, I knew you’d pull through for me!”
^Her voice echoes down the hall as she skips away happily. You feel warm inside knowing you were able to solve another person's problems.
^You reassure yourself. Everything will be ok. Nessie will make it through this, and so will you.
computerdeny: ^It feels like a struggle to get the words out, knowing how she will react.
^“It’s ok!! I know you are under a lot of pressure right now too!”
^The air has become overwhelmingly awkward. You felt like you were making so much progress too…
^“I can maybe put out an inquiry to the other guests?”
^“Excuse me, I have to go write up a report… on paper…”
^She trudges off sadly, and you feel kind of bad. The oppressive feeling of eyes on the back of your head has faded. You sigh in relief.
